titleStmt.title: Two letters sent to the Honoble [sic] William Lenthal Esq., Speaker of the Honorable House of Commons the one, concerning the great victory obtained at Cardiffe by the Parliaments forces under the command of Major General Laughorn wherein were slain about two hundred and fifty, eight hundred taken prisoners whereof two lieut. colonels, two majors, ten captains, ten lieutenants, divers ensigns, with other inferior officers : the other, concerning Sir Tho. Fairfax's march into Cornwal.
titleStmt.author: Laugharne, Rowland, d. 1676.
Rushworth, John, 1612?-1690.

notesStmt.note: The first dated Feb. 21, 1645 and signed: Rowland Laughorn; the second dated Feb. 22, 1645 and signed: Joh. Rushworth.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
